column1: '''The King of the Green Dozen''' is an incomplete story written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. It is described as a  pseudo-Celtic fairy-story with a little satire. The story is set in Wales and is about the King of Iwerddon who, along with his sons, has green hair.<ref>{{L
column3: 2}}</ref> In a letter to [[Stanley Unwin]] in 1945 Tolkien states the story is half-written and could be finished if Unwin approves of ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]''.<ref>{{L
